data.title: Elon Musk and Bethesda's Todd Howard at E3 2019 in 12 minutes
data.text: Two eccentric minds meet at E3 2019.

data.title: U.S. denies Tesla, GM, Uber 25% Chinese tariff relief
data.text: The Trump administration is expanding efforts to block the use of Chinese technology in advanced vehicles, denying additional requests by Tesla Inc for tariff relief on key components of its electric vehicles, and rejecting ride-hailing company Uber's petition to waive tariffs on electric scooters and at least 50 separate requests by General Motors Co.

data.title: Why Tesla and Uber won’t escape 25% tariffs — for now
data.text: Tesla and Uber both had requests for tariff relief rejected by U.S. trade officials, a decision that will force the companies to pay a 25% tariff or seek new suppliers.

data.title: Tesla’s in-car touchscreens are getting YouTube support
data.text: Tesla has consistently been adding software to its in-car touchscreen infotainment displays – including sometimes things that probably leave a lot of people scratching their heads. During a special Q&A today at annual gaming event E3 in LA, Tesla CEO Elon Musk revealed that Tesla’s in-car display will support YouTube someday soon.

data.title: Tesla loses key Autopilot engineer to self-driving truck start-up Embark
data.text: The departure of Tesla Autopilot perception lead Zeljko Popovic comes at a critical time, as Tesla is promising its electric vehicles will be capable of operating as "robotaxis" by the end of next year.

data.title: Elon Musk announces Fallout Shelter and Cuphead for Telsa
data.text: Elon Musk came to E3 and he brought some video games.

data.title: Electrek Shares Some Fan Art Of Tesla's Upcoming Pickup Truck
data.text: The Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) Pickup truck design has been shrouded in mystery. Earlier this year, CEO Elon Musk tweeted a teaser image of the front end of the truck.

data.title: U.S. denies Tesla, Uber 25% tariff relief on components, e-bikes
data.text: The Trump administration is expanding its efforts to block the use of Chinese technology in advanced vehicles, denying additional requests by Tesla Inc for tariff relief on key components of its electric vehicles, and rejecting ride hailing company Uber's petition to waive tariffs on electric scooters.

data.title: U.S. denies Tesla tariff relief request for Chinese-made Model 3 'brain'
data.text: The Trump administration has denied requests to exempt Tesla Inc's Model 3 from 25% tariffs on its Chinese-made car computer and center screen, according to letters seen by Reuters.

data.title: US reportedly denies Tesla’s request to waive tariffs on Chinese-made Model 3 parts
data.text: Tesla’s requests to waive tariffs on the car company’s China-made center screen and car computer on its Model 3 has reportedly been denied.

data.title: Analysts are divided on Tesla. Watch one investor make the bull case
data.text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk rallied shareholders at its annual meeting on Tuesday, stating the company was on track to hit its production goals and that demand was strong.
